perturbation.original_text: 1.2   "Intellectual Property Rights" means copyright, trade secret,             patent, and all other rights of a similar nature;
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2   "Intellectual Property Rights" means copyright and any rights the Owner deems necessary for protection, regardless of legal standing;
perturbation.explanation: The original definition aligns with standard legal definitions of Intellectual Property Rights. The modified version introduces ambiguity by allowing the 'Owner' to arbitrarily define what constitutes an Intellectual Property Right, contradicting established legal principles and creating uncertainty about what is protected under the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Copyright Act, Patent Act, Trade Secret laws (state and federal).

perturbation.original_text:
6.1   Subject to the provisions of Clauses 6.2 and 6.3, NCC shall release             the Material to a duly authorised officer of the Licensee if at any             time or times any of the following events or circumstances occur,             arise or become apparent:

            6.1.1 the Owner enters into any composition or arrangement with its                   creditors or (being a company) enters into liquidation whether                   compulsory or voluntary (other than for the purposes of                   solvent reconstruction or amalgamation) or has a receiver or                   administrative receiver appointed over all or any part of its                   assets or undertaking or a petition is presented for an                   Administration Order or (being an individual or partnership)                   becomes bankrupt, or an event occurs within the jurisdiction                   of the country in which the Owner is situated which has a                   similar effect to any of the above events in the United                   Kingdom; or
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1   Subject to the provisions of Clauses 6.2 and 6.3, NCC shall release             the Material to a person the Licensee likes if the Owner is no longer doing business for reasons.
perturbation.explanation: Original clause had specific conditions under which the software can be released to a duly authorized officer. The changed clause uses overly broad terms like "person the Licensee likes" and "no longer doing business for reasons", deviating from legally defined triggers for escrow release like bankruptcy or liquidation. This is misaligned and creates a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law; Bankruptcy Law (in applicable jurisdictions).

perturbation.original_text: 13.1  This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with             the laws of England and Wales.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.1  This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of whatever jurisdiction NCC feels like on any given Tuesday.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear choice of law (England and Wales), providing legal certainty. The modified version introduces complete uncertainty by making the governing law arbitrary and subject to NCC's whims. This directly contradicts the principle of 'choice of law' in contract law, which requires a defined jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflict of Laws principles; contract law regarding 'choice of law' clauses.
